summary: Ducks are a group of waterbirds belonging to the Anatidae family, which also includes swans and geese. They are typically smaller than swans and geese and have shorter necks. There are various duck species, categorized into different subgroups. Ducks are primarily aquatic, living in both freshwater and saltwater environments. They are often mistaken for other waterbirds with similar appearances, such as loons and grebes.
title: Duck
